name: Call of Duty® 2

reviews: Game looks amazing, even after all these years. And who would have thought that it's been 20 years already. Still works flavlesly, even on windows 11.

The best game in the Call of Duty franchise. No melodrama or silly inter-personal conflict driven plot. Just WWII in video game format, with you as a grunt. Iterates and improves on its predecessor in all the right ways.

It’s alright.

Nowhere near the best of the series, but it’ll do if you need pure and simple shooting gallery to ease your mind after work (or after System Shock, in my case).

Some setpieces are better than others, though; the number of the exact same two-story houses I cleaned at the tail end of the English campaign and the beginning of the American one is bordering on ridiculous.

This game is awesome! Like it predecessor "Call of Duty" and its successor "Call of Duty: World at War" - its one of the only games that are well made for WWII (in my opinion these 3 games are the only good ones connected with WWII). The graphics, yes, they are old, but they look good, I believe. They still hold up and look well for 20 years later. Unlike its predecessor, the graphics don't feel as old. A big improvement there. Gameplay is fun as frick! It's amazing, again, yes, nothing special, but tons of fun and a lot to do, you even have Multiplayer introduced here. It's a WWII FPS, nothing to fancy, but you don't need fancy here, it's just so good. Storyline is great. I love it! Thanks to these games (when I was about 8-9 years old), I learned a lot about history and put myself in these scenarios. I can only imagine what people went through, I tear up at some missions, remembering that this all actually happened. I would highly recommend playing this game! 
Overall I would give this game as well, a 10/10! For sure. All 3 of the mentioned CoD games are the only good CoD and WWII games, I've ever played (FPS-wise).
